rationale: French government actively enforces SecNumCloud for public sector and critical infrastructure. ANSSI conducts audits.
regulatoryTrends: Increasing enforcement; government contracts require SecNumCloud certification

rationale: NIS2 has significant penalties (up to €10M or 2% of turnover) and member states are transposing into national law

recentActions.description: NIS2 transposition deadline reached; enforcement begins

regulatoryTrends: Active enforcement expected across all EU member states

rationale: DORA is a regulation (directly applicable) with strong ESA oversight. Financial regulators are preparing enforcement.

recentActions.description: DORA becomes enforceable; supervisory authorities active

regulatoryTrends: Financial regulators prioritizing ICT third-party risk oversight

rationale: GDPR has extensive enforcement history with billions in fines issued since 2018

recentActions.description: €1.2 billion fine for inadequate data transfer safeguards to US
€390 million fine for forced consent to personalized advertising

regulatoryTrends: Continued aggressive enforcement, particularly for data transfers

rationale: DPAs actively enforcing Schrems II requirements; Meta fine demonstrates willingness to act

recentActions.description: €1.2 billion fine and data transfer suspension order

regulatoryTrends: US-EU Data Privacy Framework provides some relief but continued scrutiny expected

rationale: PDPL is relatively new; SDAIA building enforcement capacity
regulatoryTrends: Enforcement expected to increase as SDAIA matures

rationale: C5 is primarily used for procurement decisions rather than direct enforcement
regulatoryTrends: Increasing adoption in public sector procurement

rationale: AI Act is new; enforcement mechanisms still being established
regulatoryTrends: Member states establishing national supervisory authorities; guidance expected
